user.title: Add Emergency Alert
user.description: Configure a new emergency alert to monitor entities and trigger actions.

data_description.name: A unique name for this emergency alert (e.g., 'Front Door Left Open')
data_description.trigger_type: How this alert should be triggered - Simple monitors one entity, Template uses Jinja2 expressions, Logical combines multiple conditions
data_description.entity_id: The Home Assistant entity to monitor (required for Simple triggers)
data_description.trigger_state: The state value that triggers this alert (e.g., 'on', 'open', 'high', or numeric values)
data_description.template: Jinja2 template that returns true/false (e.g., {{ states('sensor.temperature')|float > 30 }})
data_description.logical_conditions: JSON or YAML list of conditions to combine with AND logic
data_description.action_service: Legacy single service to call (use 'Actions When Triggered' instead)
data_description.severity: Severity level affects how the alert is displayed and prioritized
data_description.group: Organize alerts into logical groups for better management
data_description.on_triggered: List of services to call when alert is triggered (JSON: [{"service": "notify.notify", "data": {"message": "Alert!"}}])
data_description.on_cleared: List of services to call when alert condition clears
data_description.on_escalated: List of services to call if alert is not acknowledged within 5 minutes

abort.already_configured: Alert with this name already exists
abort.single_instance_allowed: Only a single configuration of this integration is allowed.
